definition: to show an interest in/to get involved with
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: As a leader, he rarely cared about the conditions of his place and was called "the minister who manages nothing".
sentences.chinese: 領導，卻很少過問單位的事情，大家都叫他不管部長。

sentences.english: But he doesn't even have a right to say.
sentences.chinese: 可即使他現在也無權過問。

sentences.english: You have no right to seek into my life without just cause.
sentences.chinese: 沒有正當理由你無權過問我的生活。

sentences.english: No one ever asked us what we actually wanted to do.
sentences.chinese: 但沒有人想過問我們真正想做什麼。

sentences.english: And those who got sick were left to die.
sentences.chinese: 有病的人無人過問，只得等死。

sentences.english: My parents are very well trained [not to ask].
sentences.chinese: 我的父母非常有素質，不會過問這些事情。

sentences.english: Keep your mouth shut, you get no say in it.
sentences.chinese: 閉上你的嘴，你無權過問此事。

sentences.english: True history being a mixture of all things, the true historian mingles in everything.
sentences.chinese: 歷史既然包羅一切，真正的歷史學家便應過問一切。

sentences.english: But I do worry about are policies in which the xians have no say.
sentences.chinese: 我擔心的是縣無權過問的政策。

sentences.english: The activities flown to the wild goose south, they didn't excessively interfere with.
sentences.chinese: 對雁南飛的行蹤，他們並沒有過多地過問。

sentences.english: Finally, under the intervention of emperor Shunzhi, the two robbers were decapitated in the end.
sentences.chinese: 在順治帝的親自過問下，終於使二賊伏法。

sentences.english: It's been standing there, abandoned, since 1992.
sentences.chinese: 從1992年以來它就孤零零的立在那，無人再過問。
這個問題還是無人過問。
